Quotations.ab: On the Panji, Yašt-ī Gahānbār, Yašt-ī Gāϑābiiō, vid. VrS0.6.

Nerangs.ab: zōt pāy ī dašn andar nihišn dast *abar barsom nihišn stāomī aṣ̌əm pad barsom gōwišn barsom az barsomdān ul dārišn ud ka stāomī aṣ̌əm nē pad barsom gōwēd ātaxšgāh nōg pad pādyāb kunišn ud ka nē ranǰagīhā abastāg hamāg az pāy be aməša spəṇta vasasca ud ka ranǰagīhātar ēn ud pāy kunišn bišāmrūt ud šnūman wizārišnīh ud wāz zōt fərastuiie az *yasn [tā] imat̰ barəsma wa ahurāi mazdāi tā daϑušō tā aētat̰adim tā ān 3 hād ud hādān sar vaŋhuca

"The zōt has to put his right foot in, put his hand on the barsom, say staōmī aṣ̌əm next to the barsom. He has to remove it from the barsomdān. If he does not say staōmī aṣ̌əm next to the barsom, then he has to clean again the ātaxšgāh with pādyāb. If he can do it without trouble, he has to recite the whole abastāg standing, except aməša spəṇta vasasca (Y8.4-11). If it is troublesome for him, he has to stand as much as the stanzas said twice, the dedicatories and the wāz gīrišnīh and the zōt (as much as) from fərastuiie from the yasn (Y0.4) to imat̰ barəsma (Y2.1) and (from) ahurāi mazdāi (Y24.1) to daϑušō (Y24.12) and until aētat̰adim (Y27.1) and until these three hād, the end of the hāds : vaŋhuca (Y52)."

Quotations.ab: Cf. N28.30-1 Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2003, pp. 90-91:

ka-š nē *ranjagīhā ā-š abestāg hamāg az pāy gōwišn be vasasca *tū ahura mazda ud aməṣ̌a spəṇta. ka-š ranjagīhā ēn and az pāy gōwišn bišāmrūd ud srīšāmrūd ud cahrušāmrūd ud šnūman wizārišnīh ud wāz gīrišnīh ud srōš barišnīh az yašt bun [tā] imat̰ barəsma haδa zaōθrəm az ahurāi mazdāi tā daθušō, ud az aētat̰ dim tā hān yašt sar hādān sar hamāg vaŋhucā vaŋhā̊scā *abestāg pad ranjagīhātar ka nišīnān gōwēd nē tarmenišnīhā

"If he can do it without trouble, he should recite the Avestan texts standing up, except for vasasca tū ahura mazda and aməṣ̌a spəṇta. If (standing up) is troublesome for him, he should recite the following texts standing up: the passages to be recited twice, three times, and four times; the recitation of the šnūmans; the taking of the wāz; and the srōš-barišnīh; from the beginning of the service up to imat̰ barəsma haδa zaoθrəm; from ahurāi mazdāi up to daθušō; and from aētat̰ dim up to the end of that act of worship: the end of the hād: all the abastāg up to vaŋhucā vaŋhā̊sca. If it is even more troublesome, it is not disrespectful if he recites (everything) sitting down."
